评论概述: SOJOS Cat Eye Sunglasses: Stylish, Durable, and Almost Perfect!
评论详情: The SOJOS Square Cat Eye Polarized Sunglasses for Women, specifically the Retro Classic Vintage Trendy Cateye Shades Sunnies Gafas de sole SJ2235, are an absolute match to the product photo! These shades are not just stylish; they're remarkably durable, which is a huge plus.  What I truly admire about SOJOS is their knack for offering good-quality sunglasses at an affordable price. Their range includes polarized options in various styles, which is fantastic. However, while these shades have a dark lens, I do wish they were polarized for that extra protection, especially in intense sunlight.  Despite this small downside, I'm a loyal SOJOS fan and will continue purchasing from them. I discovered this brand years ago, and their sunglasses have never disappointed me. Even though these specific shades aren't polarized, they still deliver in style and durability, making me a happy customer!

When I look through these sunglasses, there is a reflection on the inside edge of the lenses on both sides. I can see my hair, the side of my face, and a lot of what’s behind me. That doesn’t happen with the other two pair of sunglasses I have. The difference is that the Sojos are almost straight across the front with very little curve in the frames or lenses. My other two pair of sunglasses have a curve in the frame and lenses which takes care of the reflection issue.  When I wear these sunglasses, and place the temples on my ears, the lenses are tilted upwards. Looking straight ahead, I’m looking through the lenses. Looking down, I’m looking under the bottom edge. For example, if I was reading a book; when viewing a page, about 2/3 of it would be through the lenses. The bottom third would be under the lenses. Also, the glasses look very weird from the side with the lenses tilted like that.  The frame across the top of these glasses is substantial. When I wear them I’m very aware of it. In fact, I’m aware of the frame all the way around, but the top is the worst.  All of these factors combine to make wearing these sunglasses an unpleasant experience because they trigger my vertigo, especially the reflection on the inside of the lenses. When I move my head from side to side, which happens quite a bit when driving, the trigger is instantaneous.  Even if these glasses didn’t trigger my vertigo, I still wouldn’t like them. The tilted lenses are unattractive, and don't give me full coverage from the sun, and the heavy frames are distracting.

I’ll be using these as beach sunglasses. They’re something you can throw in a bag and not worry much about getting them scratched. They included a cloth carrying case and cleaning cloth.. pretty unexpected given the price point. Personally, these are a bit too bold for me to wear daily, but I would use for fun beach or in or around the pool sunglasses. (Note that there is a care maintenance that says to avoid salt water and excessive heat.. so be careful when at beach).  I think some influencers might be all over this design as they are affordable and can make quite a style statement. 😊 I’m not quite as bold and these seem a bit too oversized for my face (maybe that’s the intent?) overall, love that they are polarized, love the design.. just not 100% on how they look on me personally.
